summary: Stomach cancer is a malignant tumor that develops in the lining of the stomach due to abnormal cell growth. Most cases are gastric carcinomas, with subtypes like gastric adenocarcinomas. Lymphomas and mesenchymal tumors can also occur in the stomach. It is the fifth-leading type of cancer globally and the third-leading cause of cancer death.
causes: Genetic syndromes (e.g., hereditary diffuse gastric cancer)
risk_factors: Dietary factors (pickled vegetables, salted foods, processed meats, red meat)
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes
Bloating of the stomach after meals
diagnosis: Medical imaging (CT scan, PET scan, endoscopic ultrasound)
Tumor marker tests (e.g., carcinoembryonic antigen, carbohydrate antigen)
treatments: Surgery (gastrectomy, endoscopic mucosal resection, endoscopic submucosal dissection)
Chemotherapy (e.g., 5-fluorouracil, cisplatin, epirubicin, etoposide, docetaxel, oxaliplatin, capecitabine, irinotecan)
Targeted therapy (e.g., trastuzumab for HER2-overexpressing cancer)
Bone marrow or stem cell transplant
subtypes: Extranodal marginal zone B-cell lymphomas (MALT type)
